nodes.name: Type constraint for goals
nodes.fol: (forall (e a) (if (goal e a)(and (eventuality e)(agent a))))
nodes.english: If eventuality e is a goal of agent a, then e is an eventuality and a is an agent

nodes.name: Agents know causal facts - cause version
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 x) (if (p' e1 x) (exists (e2)(and (q' e2 x)(cause e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: Agents know facts about what causes what - if p holds of x in e1, then there exists e2 where q holds of x and e1 causes e2

nodes.name: Agents know causal facts - enable version
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 x) (if (p' e1 x) (exists (e2)(and (q' e2 x)(enable e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: Agents know facts about what enables what - if p holds of x in e1, then there exists e2 where q holds of x and e1 enables e2

nodes.name: Simple goal causation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(cause e1 e2))(goal e1 a)))
nodes.english: If agent a has goal e2 and e1 causes e2, then a will also have e1 as a goal

nodes.name: Goal causation with belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (goal e1 a)))
nodes.english: If a has goal e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then a will have e1 as a goal

nodes.name: Reified goal causation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1)(and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)))))
nodes.english: If agent a wants e2 and believes e1 causes e2, that wanting will cause a to want e1

nodes.name: Subgoal relation in goal causation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: If agent a wants e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then a will want e1 as a subgoal of e2

nodes.name: Defeasible subgoal adoption via causation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)(etc)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: If agent a has a goal e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then defeasibly this wanting e2 will cause a to want e1 as a subgoal of e2

nodes.name: Simple goal enablement
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(enable e1 e2))(goal e1 a)))
nodes.english: If agent a has goal e2 and e1 enables e2, then a will also have e1 as a goal

nodes.name: Goal enablement with belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(enable' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (goal e1 a)))
nodes.english: If a has goal e2 and believes e1 enables e2, then a will have e1 as a goal

nodes.name: Reified goal enablement
nodes.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(enable' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1)(and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)))))
nodes.english: If agent a wants e2 and believes e1 enables e2, that wanting will cause a to want e1

nodes.name: Subgoal relation in goal enablement
nodes.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(enable' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: If g2 is a's having a goal e2 and a believes that e1 enables e2, then there will be a g1 that is a's having a goal e1, e1 will be a subgoal of e2, and a's having goal e2 causes a to have goal e1

nodes.name: Definition of subgoal relation
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (subgoal e1 e2) (exists (a e3 e4 e5 s) (and (goal e2 a)(goal e1 a) (causalComplex' e3 s e2)(member' e4 e1 s) (and' e5 e3 e4)(believe a e5)))))
nodes.english: The subgoal relation is a relation between two goals, and implies the agent's belief that the subgoal is in a causal complex for the goal

nodes.name: Transitivity of subgoal relation
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e2 e3 a) (if (and (subgoal e1 e2)(subgoal e2 e3)) (subgoal e1 e3)))
nodes.english: The subgoal relation is transitive

nodes.name: Believing you have a goal implies you do
nodes.fol: (forall (e e1 a) (if (and (goal' e e1 a)(believe a e)(etc)) (Rexist e)))
nodes.english: If one believes he or she has a goal, then defeasibly he or she really does have the goal. We are usually pretty reliable about knowing what we want

nodes.name: Definition of knowledgeGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (knowledgeGoal e a) (exists (e1) (and (goal e1 a)(know' e1 a e)))))
nodes.english: A knowledge goal is a goal of knowing something, because most actions have knowledge prerequisites

nodes.name: Definition of preservationGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e a t) (iff (preservationGoal e a t) (exists (e1 t1) (and (goal e1 a)(during' e1 e t) (begins t1 t)(atTime e t1)))))
nodes.english: A preservation goal is a goal that some state that is true now remain true in the future, over some time period

nodes.name: Definition of preservationGoalViolation
nodes.fol: (forall (e a t) (iff (preservationGoalViolation e a t) (exists (e1 t1) (and (preservationGoal e a t)(not' e1 e)(atTime e1 t1) (insideTime t1 t)))))
nodes.english: It is possible for a preservation goal to be violated

nodes.name: Definition of persistentGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e a t) (iff (persistentGoal e a t) (exists (e1) (and (goal' e1 e a)(during e1 t)))))
nodes.english: A goal can be persistent in that it remains a goal even after it is achieved. The condition e1 is e's being a goal of agent a, and it holds all through time interval t

nodes.name: Definition of envisionedFutureGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e a t1 t2) (iff (envisionedFutureGoal e a t1 t2) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (thinkOf' e1 a e3)(atTime' e3 e2 t2)(goal' e2 e a) (atTime e1 t1)(before t1 t2)))))
nodes.english: Some goals are envisioned to be desired only at some point in the future. e is a goal that agent a imagines at time t1 having at some subsequent time t2

nodes.name: Definition of achievedGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e a t1 t2) (iff (achievedGoal e a t1 t2) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (goal' e1 e a)(atTime e1 t1) (instance e3 e)(atTime' e2 e3 t2) (before t1 t2)(cause e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: Sometimes goals are achieved. A goal that has been achieved is an eventuality that was once a goal and now really exists, and its once having been a goal should have played a causal role in its current real existence

nodes.name: Definition of unachievedGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e a t1 t2) (iff (unachievedGoal e a t1 t2) (exists (e1 e2) (and (atTime' e2 e t2)(goal' e1 e2 a) (atTime e1 t1)(before t1 t2) (not (exists (e3) (and (instance e3 e) (atTime e3 t2))))))))
nodes.english: Sometimes goals are not achieved. Eventuality e was a goal of a's at time t1 and it (or an instance of it) does not really exist at time t2

nodes.name: Definition of neverAchievedGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e a t1) (iff (neverAchievedGoal e a t1) (forall (t2) (if (before t1 t2)(unachievedGoal e a t1 t2)))))
nodes.english: Sometimes goals are never achieved. Eventuality e that agent a had as a goal at time t1 has never subsequently happened

nodes.name: Definition of conflictingGoals
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e2 a) (iff (conflictingGoals e1 e2 a) (and (goal e1 a)(goal e2 a) (forall (e3 t) (if (and (instance e3 e1)(atTime e3 t)) (exists (e4) (and (not' e4 e2)(atTime e4 t))))))))
nodes.english: Goals can be classified with respect to each other. It is possible for goals to conflict with each other - both e1 and e2 are goals of a's, but if an instance of one holds at some time t, then the negation of the other holds at time t as well

nodes.name: Definition of auxiliaryGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e2 a) (iff (auxiliaryGoal e1 e2 a) (exists (e0 e3 e4 e5 e6 e7) (and (goal' e0 e1 a)(goal e2 a) (if (and (changeTo' e3 e4)(believe' e4 a e5) (conflictingGoals' e5 e1 e2 a)) (and (cause e3 e6)(changeFrom' e6 e0)))))))
nodes.english: A goal can be auxiliary to another goal, in the sense that the agent wants both goals, but in case of conflict between the goals, the auxiliary goal is the one that is abandoned

nodes.name: Definition of sharedGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e s e1) (iff (sharedGoal' e e1 s) (exists (e0) (and (goal' e0 e1 s)(mb s e0)(gen e0 e) (forall (x)(if (member x s)(agent x)))))))
nodes.english: A shared or collaborative goal is a goal in which the agent having the goal is a collective. Moreover, the members of the collective mutually believe the collective has the goal

nodes.name: Individual goals from shared goals
nodes.fol: (forall (x s e1) (if (and (sharedGoal e1 s)(member x s)) (goal e1 x)))
nodes.english: Because mutual belief implies belief and because if you believe you have a goal then you do really do have the goal, it follows that the individual members of s have e1 as a goal

nodes.name: Definition of competitiveGoals
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e2 a1 a2) (iff (competitiveGoals e1 e2 a1 a2) (exists (e3) (and (subst a1 e1 a2 e2)(goal e1 a1)(goal e2 a2) (and' e3 e1 e2) (not (exists (e4 t) (and (instance e4 e3) (atTime e4 t))))))))
nodes.english: The goals of different agents can conflict. One way is for the goals to be competitive - more than one agent has the goal of the same property being true of himself. a1 plays the same role in e1 as a2 plays in e2, a1 has e1 as a goal, a2 has e2 as a goal, and they can't both hold at once

nodes.name: Definition of adversarialGoals
nodes.fol: (forall (a1 a2 e1) (iff (adversarialGoals e1 a1 a2) (exists (e2) (and (goal e1 a1)(goal e2 a2)(not' e2 e1)))))
nodes.english: In adversarial goals, the goals are in direct conflict. One agent wants a goal and the other agent wants its negation

nodes.name: Definition of try
nodes.fol: (forall (e a e1) (iff (try' e a e1) (exists (e0 e2 e3 e4) (and (goal e1 a)(subgoal' e3 e2 e1)(instance e4 e2) (agentOf a e4)(cause e3 e4)(gen e4 e)))))
nodes.english: When we try to bring about some goal, we devise at least a partial plan to achieve it, including subgoals of the original goal which are actions on our part, and we execute some of those subgoals. Moreover, our executing those actions is a direct result of our having those actions as subgoals

nodes.name: Trying implies causally involved action
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1) (if (try a e1) (exists (e2 e3 e4) (and (instance e3 e1)(causallyInvolved' e4 e2 e3) (believe a e4)(agentOf a e2)))))
nodes.english: It follows that if you try to do something e1, then you perform some action or actions that you believe are causally involved in effecting an instance of e1

nodes.name: Definition of succeed
nodes.fol: (forall (e a e1) (iff (succeed' e a e1) (exists (e2 e3) (and (try' e2 a e1)(instance e3 e1) (cause e2 e3)(gen e3 e)))))
nodes.english: To succeed at some goal is to try to do it and to have that trying cause the goal to actually occur

nodes.name: Definition of fail
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1) (iff (fail a e1) (and (try a e1) (not (exists (e2) (and (instance e2 e1)(Rexist e2)))))))
nodes.english: To fail at some goal is to try to do it and for it not to actually occur

nodes.name: Definition of functionality0
nodes.fol: (forall (x e) (if (and (compositeEntity x)(changeIn' e x)) (iff (functionality0 e x) (exists (e2 e3 a) (and (goal' e2 e a)(agent' e3 a)(imply e3 e2))))))
nodes.english: A composite entity that goes through changes can be viewed as having as an associated goal some element or subset of those changes. We will define that 'goal' as the functionality of the whole

nodes.name: Definition of functionality
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 y e x) (iff (functionality e1 y e x) (exists (s) (and (functionality0 e x)(causalComplex s e) (member e1 s)(arg* y e1)(componentOf y x)))))
nodes.english: If a component has some property or engages in some behavior that is in a causal complex for the functionality of the composite entity as a whole, we can say that property or behavior is the functionality of the component with respect to the functionality0 of the whole

nodes.name: Definition of intact
nodes.fol: (forall (x) (iff (intact x) (forall (e1 y e) (if (functionality e1 y e x) (not (exists (e2 e3) (and (arg* y e2)(not' e3 e1) (cause e2 e3))))))))
nodes.english: A component is intact if it is able to fulfill its functionality. That is, there are no properties of the component that would cause the functionality not to occur

nodes.name: Definition of goodFor
nodes.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (goodFor e a) (exists (e1 s) (and (goal e1 a)(causalComplex s e1)(member e s)))))
nodes.english: An eventuality is good for us if it contributes causally somehow to the achievement of one of our goals

nodes.name: Definition of badFor
nodes.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (badFor e a) (exists (e1 e2 s) (and (not' e2 e1)(goal e1 a)(causalComplex s e2) (member e s)))))
nodes.english: An eventuality is bad for us if it contributes causally somehow to the nonachievment of one of our goals

nodes.name: Type constraint for moreValuable
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 a) (if (moreValuable x1 x2 a)(and (nequal x1 x2)(agent a))))
nodes.english: A concept, entity or eventuality is more or less valuable to an agent depending on its relation to the agent's goals. The entities being compared are distinct

nodes.name: Type constraint for moreCostly
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 a) (if (moreCostly x1 x2 a)(and (nequal x1 x2)(agent a))))
nodes.english: Type constraint for cost comparison - entities being compared must be distinct and a must be an agent

nodes.name: Type constraint for moreImportant
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 a) (if (moreImportant x1 x2 a)(and (nequal x1 x2)(agent a))))
nodes.english: Type constraint for importance comparison - entities being compared must be distinct and a must be an agent

nodes.name: Transitivity of moreValuable
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 x3 a) (if (and (moreValuable x1 x2 a)(moreValuable x2 x3 a)) (moreValuable x1 x3 a)))
nodes.english: Being partial orderings, the three relations are transitive - value version

nodes.name: Transitivity of moreCostly
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 x3 a) (if (and (moreCostly x1 x2 a)(moreCostly x2 x3 a)) (moreCostly x1 x3 a)))
nodes.english: Being partial orderings, the three relations are transitive - cost version

nodes.name: Transitivity of moreImportant
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 x3 a) (if (and (moreImportant x1 x2 a)(moreImportant x2 x3 a)) (moreImportant x1 x3 a)))
nodes.english: Being partial orderings, the three relations are transitive - importance version

nodes.name: Definition of ubSupergoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 s a) (iff (ubSupergoal e1 s a) (and (agent a)(goal e1 a)(not (member e1 s)) (forall (e2) (if (member e2 s)(subgoal e2 e1))) (forall (e2 e3) (if (and (member e2 s)(subgoal e2 e3)) (or (subgoal e3 e1)(equal e3 e1) (exists (g1 g3) (and (subgoal' g1 e2 e1) (subgoal' g3 e2 e3) (if (changeFrom g1) (changeFrom g3))))))))))
nodes.english: An eventuality e1 is an upper bound supergoal of e2 if every path from the top-level goal down to e2 passes through e1. Thus, every reason for doing e2 is in service of e1

nodes.name: Definition of lubSupergoal
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 s a) (iff (lubSupergoal e1 s a) (and (ubSupergoal e1 s a) (forall (e) (if (ubSupergoal e s a) (or (equal e e1)(subgoal e1 e)))))))
nodes.english: A goal e1 is a least upper bound supergoal if it is an upper bound supergoal and a subgoal of all other upper bound supergoals

nodes.name: Least upper bound supergoal more valuable
nodes.fol: (forall (s e1 e2 a) (if (and (singleton s e2)(lubSupergoal e1 s a)) (moreValuable e1 e2 a)))
nodes.english: If eventuality e1 dominates eventuality e2 on every path in the agent's plan that includes e2, then e1 is more valuable than e2. Every reason for wanting e2 is in the service of e1

nodes.name: Least upper bound supergoal more costly
nodes.fol: (forall (s e1 e2 a) (if (and (singleton s e2)(lubSupergoal e1 s a)) (moreCostly e1 e2 a)))
nodes.english: Cost version of least upper bound supergoal dominance

nodes.name: Least upper bound supergoal more important
nodes.fol: (forall (s e1 e2 a) (if (and (singleton s e2)(lubSupergoal e1 s a)) (moreImportant e1 e2 a)))
nodes.english: Importance version of least upper bound supergoal dominance

nodes.name: Supergoal more valuable than goal set
nodes.fol: (forall (s e a) (if (lubSupergoal e s a)(moreValuable e s a)))
nodes.english: The least upper bound supergoal of a set of goals is more important than the whole set, as all the members of the set are in the service of the supergoal - value version

nodes.name: Supergoal more costly than goal set
nodes.fol: (forall (s e a) (if (lubSupergoal e s a)(moreCostly e s a)))
nodes.english: Cost version of supergoal dominance over goal set

nodes.name: Supergoal more important than goal set
nodes.fol: (forall (s e a) (if (lubSupergoal e s a)(moreImportant e s a)))
nodes.english: Importance version of supergoal dominance over goal set

nodes.name: Definition of posGoalRelevant
nodes.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (posGoalRelevant e a) (exists (e1) (and (goal e1 a)(imply e e1)))))
nodes.english: An eventuality e is positively goal-relevant to an agent a if its occurrence implies the satisfaction of some goal e1 of a's

nodes.name: Definition of negGoalRelevant
nodes.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (negGoalRelevant e a) (exists (e1 e2) (and (goal e1 a)(not' e2 e1)(imply e e2)))))
nodes.english: An eventuality e is negatively goal-relevant to an agent a if its occurrence implies the satisfaction of the negation e2 of some goal e1 of a's

nodes.name: Definition of goalRelevant
nodes.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (goalRelevant e a) (or (posGoalRelevant e a)(negGoalRelevant e a))))
nodes.english: An eventuality as 'goal-relevant' to an agent if its existence implies the existence or nonexistence of one of the agent's goals

nodes.name: Definition of posGoalConsequences
nodes.fol: (forall (s e a) (iff (posGoalConsequences s e a) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 s) (and (goal e1 a)(imply e e1))))))
nodes.english: The positive goal consequences of an eventuality are those goals that are positively impacted by e

nodes.name: Definition of negGoalConsequences
nodes.fol: (forall (s e a) (iff (negGoalConsequences s e a) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 s) (and (goal e1 a) (exists (e2) (not' e2 e1)(imply e e2)))))))
nodes.english: The negative goal consequences of an eventuality are those goals that are negatively impacted by e

nodes.name: Definition of goalConsequences
nodes.fol: (forall (s e a) (iff (goalConsequences s e a) (exists (s1 s2) (and (posGoalConsequences s1 e a) (negGoalConsequences s2 e a) (union s s1 s2)))))
nodes.english: The goal consequences of an eventuality combine positive and negative goal consequences

nodes.name: Value transfer from goal consequences - first direction
nodes.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreValuable x s a)(posGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreValuable x e a)))
nodes.english: The value of an eventuality depends on the value of its goal consequences. If something x is more valuable than the goal consequences of eventuality e, then it is more valuable than e

nodes.name: Value transfer from goal consequences - second direction
nodes.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreValuable s x a)(posGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreValuable e x a)))
nodes.english: Second direction of value transfer from goal consequences to eventuality

nodes.name: Cost transfer from goal consequences - first direction
nodes.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreCostly x s a)(negGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreCostly x e a)))
nodes.english: Cost version of goal consequence transfer - first direction

nodes.name: Cost transfer from goal consequences - second direction
nodes.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreCostly s x a)(negGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreCostly e x a)))
nodes.english: Cost version of goal consequence transfer - second direction

nodes.name: Importance transfer from goal consequences - first direction
nodes.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreImportant x s a)(goalConsequences s e a)) (moreImportant x e a)))
nodes.english: Importance version of goal consequence transfer - first direction

nodes.name: Importance transfer from goal consequences - second direction
nodes.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreImportant s x a)(goalConsequences s e a)) (moreImportant e x a)))
nodes.english: Importance version of goal consequence transfer - second direction

nodes.name: Definition of posGrProps
nodes.fol: (forall (s x a) (iff (posGrProps s x a) (forall (e) (iff (member e s) (and (arg* x e)(posGoalRelevant e a))))))
nodes.english: The value, cost, and importance of an entity depends on the value, cost, and importance of its properties and of the events it participates in. Positive goal-relevant properties

nodes.name: Definition of negGrProps
nodes.fol: (forall (s x a) (iff (negGrProps s x a) (forall (e) (iff (member e s) (and (arg* x e)(negGoalRelevant e a))))))
nodes.english: Negative goal-relevant properties of an entity

nodes.name: Definition of grProps
nodes.fol: (forall (s x a) (iff (grProps s x a) (forall (e) (iff (member e s) (and (arg* x e)(goalRelevant e a))))))
nodes.english: All goal-relevant properties of an entity (positive and negative)

nodes.name: Value transfer from entity properties - first direction
nodes.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreValuable x1 s a)(posGrProps s x2 a)) (moreValuable x1 x2 a)))
nodes.english: The value, cost, and importance of an entity depend on the value, cost, and importance of its goal-relevant properties. Value version - first direction

nodes.name: Value transfer from entity properties - second direction
nodes.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreValuable s x1 a)(posGrProps s x2 a)) (moreValuable x2 x1 a)))
nodes.english: Value version - second direction

nodes.name: Cost transfer from entity properties - first direction
nodes.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreCostly x1 s a)(negGrProps s x2 a)) (moreCostly x1 x2 a)))
nodes.english: Cost version - first direction

nodes.name: Cost transfer from entity properties - second direction
nodes.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreCostly s x1 a)(negGrProps s x2 a)) (moreCostly x2 x1 a)))
nodes.english: Cost version - second direction

nodes.name: Importance transfer from entity properties - first direction
nodes.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreImportant x1 s a)(grProps s x2 a)) (moreImportant x1 x2 a)))
nodes.english: Importance version - first direction

nodes.name: Importance transfer from entity properties - second direction
nodes.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreImportant s x1 a)(grProps s x2 a)) (moreImportant x2 x1 a)))
nodes.english: Importance version - second direction

nodes.name: Definition of valueScale
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (valueScale s a) (exists (s1 e x1 x2) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)(moreValuable' e x1 x2 a) (agent a)(member x1 s1)(member x2 s1)))))
nodes.english: We can now define a value scale as a scale whose components are any arbitrary set and whose partial ordering is moreValuable

nodes.name: Definition of valuable
nodes.fol: (forall (x a) (iff (valuable x a) (exists (s s1) (and (valueScale s a)(Hi s1 s)(inScale x s1)))))
nodes.english: Something is valuable to an agent a if it is in the Hi region of a's value scale

nodes.name: Definition of value
nodes.fol: (forall (x y a) (iff (value y x a) (exists (s) (and (valueScale s a)(inScale y a)(equal x y)))))
nodes.english: The value of something, its place in a value scale, is just itself, as an element in that scale. y is the value of x to agent a if y simply is x and it has a place in a value scale

nodes.name: Definition of costScale
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (costScale s a) (exists (s1 e x1 x2) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)(moreCostly' e x1 x2 a) (agent a)(member x1 s1)(member x2 s1)))))
nodes.english: Cost scale definition parallel to value scale

nodes.name: Definition of importanceScale
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (importanceScale s a) (exists (s1 e x1 x2) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)(moreImportant' e x1 x2 a) (agent a)(member x1 s)(member x2 s)))))
nodes.english: Importance scale definition parallel to value scale

nodes.name: Definition of costly
nodes.fol: (forall (x a) (iff (costly x a) (exists (s s1) (and (costScale s a)(Hi s1 s)(inScale x s1)))))
nodes.english: Something is costly to an agent if it is in the Hi region of the agent's cost scale

nodes.name: Definition of important
nodes.fol: (forall (x a) (iff (important x a) (exists (s s1) (and (importanceScale s a)(Hi s1 s)(inScale x s1)))))
nodes.english: Something is important to an agent if it is in the Hi region of the agent's importance scale

nodes.name: Definition of cost
nodes.fol: (forall (x y a) (iff (cost y x a) (exists (s) (and (costScale s a)(inScale y a)(equal x y)))))
nodes.english: The cost of something is its place in a cost scale

nodes.name: Definition of importance
nodes.fol: (forall (x y a) (iff (importance y x a) (exists (s) (and (importanceScale s a)(inScale y a)(equal x y)))))
nodes.english: The importance of something is its place in an importance scale

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
